18.title: "El Mito del Superhéroe"
18.author: Perucho Mejía G
18.appears_in: p. 9-12 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 2, no. 5 (Mar. 2002).
notes: Includes illustrations and bibliographical references.
Presented at the 7th Encuentro Internacional de Historietistas, Havana, Feb. 2002.

Resumen: "Este ensayo, examina y argumenta el análisis semiótico del superhéroe; su discurso, su contexto social y uso de símbolos, así como sus influencias humanas y persuasivas en una cultura determinada. Un superhéroe, representa con sus caracterizaciones diversos roles, y de esta forma se puede analizar como mito."

Summary: "This essay examines and argues the semiotic analysis of the superhero; his discourse, his social context and use of symbols as well as his persuasive and human influences in a particular culture. A superhero represents different roles in his characterizations, so in this way he can be analysed like myth."
Abstracts as published with the article, with some editing of the English.

Opportunity knocks when Mix's father dies and Mix is offered to take over the father's successful, syndicated cartoon. Question is will the son match his father's sense of humor, part of the cartoon's popularity being that it pokes fun at the oddball Mix family.
